name: Hoops
subtitle: A different kind of Social Media.
desc: Hoops is a unique social media application where users can connect and chat with each other using letters while being completely anonymous.

sections.sectionText: A smooth and beautifully designed onboarding and login.

sectionData.text: Login and Sign up screens with proper validators on available usernames and passwords constraints checking. Each keystroke triggers and API call that checks for available usernames from a staging database. Username is later verfied from actual database when clicking next.
Users are able to add their interests from a wide range of options so they can connect with people who have similar interest as theres.
Users can also add their class schedules to better coordinate potential future meetups.
We strongly discourage the use of profile pictures to negate any kind of bias. Users can add fun avatars randomly generated from their names and change them whenever they want.

sections.sectionText: A user journey that keeps you writing!

sectionData.text: The home screen is kept simple with an ample amount of white space and a sidebar that gives you a quick access to all your friends and shows you which of your friends are online. In addition, there's also a text box to post any updates along with pictures.
Friend suggestions are right on your finger tips, with the feed showing you the people with the most number of common interests and a compatible personality using the Myers-Briggs rubrick.
The platform encourages the users to make meaningful conversations using our constraint of at least 600 characters per letter.
All letters from a specific friend shown in the friend's screen, easily accessible by clicking on a friend in the sidebar.
Users can view any recieved or sent letters from and to a friend from the friend screen in a nice canvas.
